name: Brimstone at Langdale

reviews.title: Top marks for the newcomer
reviews.text: At no time did Brimstone feel like a hotel. Park in the underground car park. Buzz the entry door and you're greeted by your 'host' (their phraseology not mine). No reception to check you in. Straight to your room (which is sumptuous) and a guided tour of facilities: reading room, boot room (with Berghaus stuff to wear should you forget your own) and leisure facilities across the way in the main hotel block. Free tea and coffee in the reading room along with wine, beer, sandwiches, cakes etc etc. it's different that's for sure. Service is good (albeit breakfast taken in our room was late and they forgot some things), but could be more polished. Location is excellent; we did two of their suggested local walks and the route descriptions were faultless and the scenery fantastic. We ate in the hotel restaurant and it was very good even for our critical pallets! So, will we return. Yes, you bet we will; just need to save up first...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are lodge owners at Langdale and keep promising to come at a different time to our usual week
reviews.title: a real treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brimstone opening gave us a great excuse to do just that with some indulgence
reviews.title: The Jewel of The Lake District

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It did not let us down the room WAS fantastic the balcony also fantastic
reviews.title: Excellent birthday celebration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were attentive and friendly
reviews.title: A luxurious start to our honeymoon-fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We parked under the hotel and from then on the place felt exclusive! We were greeted by a host downstairs in the waiting area with beautiful log fire as there is no reception, and she took us up the stairs past the lounge with complimentary bar and snacks to our room. We were positively surprised at just how unusual and stunning the room was. Our huge bed was at a jaunty angle which made it a real feature, but it had to compete against the huge chrome roll top bath, the 2 huge flat screen TVs, the real log fire, the comfy corner sofa and the wrap-round balcony. We took a complimentary glass of wine back to the room and enjoyed it whilst relaxing on the sofas!
reviews.title: A Luxurious Treat

reviews.text: A really wonderful place to stay - a modern, stylish, luxurious, decadent, hi-tech place to stay in a unique and tranquil setting in the heart of the Lakes. Wonderful staff, great food. Cannot recommend this place highly enough.
reviews.title: Sumptuous Luxury! What an amazing place to stay!

reviews.text: I've never stayed in such a luxurious room before. I had a duet room for one night in June and I have to say it was so fantastic that I didn't actually want to leave the room! Lots of lovely hidden extras such as the ghd's hair dryer and ghd straighteners in the wardrobe and the mood lighting. Breakfast in bed is a great touch, but you can go to the main hotel for the buffet breakfast if you prefer. I've been to langdales a few times before and I can't remember what was there before they built the brimstone. It looks as if its always been there. The staff at the Brimstone need a mention. They are attentive, polite and happy! There is a reading room with snacks, drinks and comfy chairs. But I didn't go in there as my room was so nice!
reviews.title: Wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had our evening meal at purdeys and plumped for the taster menu - delicious!
reviews.title: Beyond amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in a Mezzanine Suite at the end of June.
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All I can say is that if you want to stay somewhere special that has the WOW factor without being stuffy then this is the place for you.
reviews.title: Brimstone - THE ultimate destination in England!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hosts made us feel so welcome from the moment we arrived.
reviews.title: Amazing 24 hours....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accommodation was fantastic....where else do you get a log burning stove...and they will even light it for you if you want.
reviews.title: Why Brimstone is THE best hotel in the Lakes!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Very special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night from Friday 26th-27th July and loved it, the rooms were gorgeous and very modern and the surrounding areas were stunning and also 5 mins away from Ambleside town centre. Very peaceful. The rooms had a TV on the wall, alarm clock in which you could put you ipod/iphone onto and the bed was really comfy. The bathroom was a wet room and had lots of useful toiletries. Breakfast in the morning was very nice we had a full English breakfast, however there was also fruit, yogurts etc The only snag really was the drinks were a little on the expensive side.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However we will definitely be returning :)
reviews.title: Wow
A wonderful 2 night break away with the family

description: Brimstone is the first development of its kind in the Lake District offering boutique luxury hotel suites and rooms. The contemporary and innovative design blends seamlessly with the stunning Lakeland landscape and extensive spa and restaurant facilities on the Estate. Brimstone will offer a new experience in the Lake District with large spaces, contemporary designs, boutique environment and service.
